thread.title: Man’s death in Larimer Square Tuesday under police investigation
thread.title_full: Man’s death in Larimer Square Tuesday under police investigation

author: Kieran Nicholson
title: Man’s death in Larimer Square Tuesday under police investigation
text: Judge denies request to delay sale of Lodge and Spa at Cordillera February 21, 2017, 1:28 pm A federal judge has rejected a plea by Cordillera homeowners to delay the sale of the luxury community’s Lodge and Spa at Cordillera, which a Baltimore company plans to convert into an upscale drug addiction treatment center. Denver police investigating after vehicle hits, seriously hurts person using wheelchair February 21, 2017, 11:20 am Denver police are investigating after a vehicle struck and seriously injured a person using a wheelchair Tuesday morning near downtown. Smiley’s Laundromat building will be demolished, replaced with 180 apartments and “local food” market February 21, 2017, 1:55 pm A Depression-era art deco building that’s been a part of Colfax Avenue for more than 80 years will be torn down and replaced with what some neighborhood groups are calling the future Denver Union Station. Fed up Arvada woman files federal lawsuit over wrong-number robo-calls February 21, 2017, 10:14 am Trudy Newell wasn’t messing around when she gave fair warning to stop calling. So when the Arvada woman called the law office of Maury Cobb, of Birmingham, Ala., and told his representatives she would sue if the barrage of robo-calls intended for someone else didn’t stop, she meant it.
